definitions.definition: (sometimes derogatory) A homeless person; a vagabond.
A disreputable, promiscuous woman; a slut.
definitions.example: "Claudia is such a tramp; making out with all those men when she has a boyfriend."

definitions.definition: Any ship which does not have a fixed schedule or published ports of call.
A long walk, possibly of more than one day, in a scenic or wilderness area.
(in apposition) Of objects, stray and intrusive and unwanted
A metal plate worn by diggers under the hollow of the foot to save the shoe.
To walk for a long time (usually through difficult terrain).
definitions.example: We tramped through the woods for hours before we found the main path again.

definitions.definition: To tread upon forcibly and repeatedly; to trample.
To cleanse, as clothes, by treading upon them in water.
A gymnastic and recreational device consisting of a piece of taut, strong fabric stretched over a steel frame using many coiled springs as anchors.
Any of a variety of looping or jumping instructions in specific programming languages
